page.title: 07JACOBS YARD
page.content: A 450 acre farm. {Crops:}160 acres of winter wheat was sold, 80% for cattle feed and 20% for bread making. 40 acres of spring barley and 70 acres of winter barley were sold, 80% for maltings 20% cattle feed. 44 acres of maize was converted to silage; 45 acres of turnips used for feed for sheep; 50 acres of peas sold for human consumption. The rest of the farm is pastures. {Livestock:}25 beef cattle, a mixture of Friesian/Hereford cross and South Devon/Hereford cross, are kept. A further 120-150 store cattle (Friesian/Hereford cross and Charolais breeds) are brought in to feed on the maize. 30 sheep and 1 Texel ram are kept throughout the year, but 350 sheep are maintained during winter with regular replacements for animals sold. {Mechanisation:}3 workers, 5 tractors, 1 combine harvester are used
